parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Vehicle Inventory </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets how much ammunition (compared to a full state defined by the vehicle type) the vehicle has. Note that the ammo will be added only to [[local]] turrets. To check locality of turret use [[turretLocal]].

The value ranges from 0 to 1. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value>  vehicleName '''setVehicleAmmo''' value </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicleName: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> value: [[Number]] - 0: empty, 1: full</value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[setVehicleAmmo]] 0;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_vehicle [[setVehicleAmmo]] 1;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[setVehicleAmmoDef]], [[ammo]], [[setAmmo]], [[setAmmoCargo]], [[turretLocal]]</value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">
<dt class="note">[[User:Ceeeb|Ceeeb]]
<dd class="note">This command does not add magazines to vehicle weapons that normally start with more than one magazine. It can however, remove these magazines.

<dd class="notedate">
<dt class="note">[[User:Bon_Inf*|Bon_Inf*]]
<dd class="note">A2:OA v1.59 - Magazines of vehicle turrets are also refilled by this command.

<dd class="notedate">
<dt class="note">[[User:kju|kju]]
<dd class="note">
* If you 'unit/vehicle setVehicleAmmo 0;' an unit/vehicle first, you cannot refill it with 'unit/vehicle setVehicleAmmo 1;'.
* You need to execute where the unit is [[local]].
* You need to execute on the [[effectiveCommander]] of a vehicle.

<dd class="notedate">
<dt class="note">[[User:Galzohar|Galzohar]]
<dd class="note">
* In Arma 3, using this command seems correctly rearm the vehicle and its turrets in all situations (tested with beta 0.72).

<dd class="notedate">
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone_Kid|Killzone_Kid]]
<dd class="note">
* In Arma 3, when using this on a player, this command can only reduce the number of magazine in relation to the current ammo quantity of the unit. For example if player has 8 magazines, [[player]] [[setVehicleAmmo]] 0.5; will leave unit with 4 mags. Executing [[player]] [[setVehicleAmmo]] 0.5; again will leave unit with 2 mags. [[player]] [[setVehicleAmmo]] 0.5; again -> 1 mag. [[player]] [[setVehicleAmmo]] 0; will remove all mags. If player had 10 mags with 30 bullets in each, [[player]] [[setVehicleAmmo]] 0.01; will leave player with loaded mag with 3 bullets in it (300 x 0.01 = 3)


<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

<h3 style="display:none">Bottom Section</h3>

[[Category:Scripting Commands Arma 3|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
[[Category:Scripting Commands Take On Helicopters|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 20, 2014 - 21:55 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Actium|Actium]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
This command does not operate ''compared to a full state defined by the vehicle type'', but rather relative to a vehicle's current magazine loadout. To get the former behaviour use [[setVehicleAmmoDef]], which utilizes the vehicles default magazine loadout (i.e. its CfgVehicles magazines[] values).
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
